message.content: Array P of n points on which the closest pair distance has to be computed by means of the divide and conquer algorithm.

element.value: 4 RETURN distance between S[l] and P[r];

message.content: The points have to be sorted in non decreasing order with respect their x-coordinate.

message.content: The points have been sorted with respect to their x-coordinate. The time required to perform the sort operation is O(nlogn) (by using, in this implementation, the merge sort algorithm).

element.value: 4 RETURN distance between S[l] and P[r];

message.content: The algorithm starts the recursive divide and conquer computation.

element.value: 4 RETURN distance between S[l] and P[r];

message.content: Since the set of active points contains more than three points, then it is split into two (almost) equally sized parts.

element.value: 4 RETURN distance between S[l] and P[r];

message.content: The algorithm recursively continues in the set of white nodes.

element.value: 4 RETURN distance between S[l] and P[r];

message.content: Since the set of active points contains more than three points, then it is split into two (almost) equally sized parts.

element.value: 4 RETURN distance between S[l] and P[r];

message.content: The algorithm recursively continues in the set of white nodes.

element.value: 4 RETURN distance between S[l] and P[r];

message.content: Since the set contains three points only, the minimum distance can be found by means of an exhaustive search.

element.value: 4 RETURN distance between S[l] and P[r];

message.content: The points have to be sorted in non decreasing order with respect their y-coordinate.

element.value: 4 RETURN distance between S[l] and P[r];

message.content: The points have been sorted with respect to their y-coordinate. The time required to perform the sort operation is clearly constant.

element.value: 4 RETURN distance between S[l] and P[r];

message.content: The distance in red has been computed and has to be compared with the distances between the other two pairs of points.

element.value: 4 RETURN distance between S[l] and P[r];

message.content: The red distance is less than the green one and it is the currently minum one.

element.value: 4 RETURN distance between S[l] and P[r];

message.content: The distance in red is less than the green one and it is the minimum one.

element.value: 4 RETURN distance between S[l] and P[r];

message.content: The minimum distance within the set of three white points has been computed and it is shown in red.

element.value: 4 RETURN distance between S[l] and P[r];

message.content: The first recursive call terminated and the minimum distance between any two white points has been stored.

element.value: 4 RETURN distance between S[l] and P[r];

message.content: The algorithm recursively continues in the set of white nodes.

element.value: 4 RETURN distance between S[l] and P[r];

message.content: Since the set contains two points only, the minimum distance is the distance between these two points.

element.value: 4 RETURN distance between S[l] and P[r];

message.content: The points have to be sorted in non decreasing order with respect their y-coordinate.

element.value: 4 RETURN distance between S[l] and P[r];

message.content: The points have to be sorted in non decreasing order with respect their y-coordinate.

element.value: 4 RETURN distance between S[l] and P[r];

message.content: The points have been sorted with respect to their y-coordinate. The time required to perform the sort operation is clearly constant.

element.value: 4 RETURN distance between S[l] and P[r];

message.content: The minimum distance within the set of two white points has been computed and it is shown in red.

element.value: 4 RETURN distance between S[l] and P[r];

message.content: The minimum distance within the set of sky blue points and the one within the set of yellow points have been computed: these two distances have now to be compared with the minimum distance between two points in two different sets (that is, the merge step of the divide and conquer algorithm starts).

element.value: 4 RETURN distance between S[l] and P[r];

message.content: The distance in red is less than the green one: this distance specifies the width of the vertical strip within which the algorithm has to look for smaller distances.

element.value: 4 RETURN distance between S[l] and P[r];

message.content: The algorithm will now select all the sky blue points which are contained in the vertical strip centered on the red point and whose width is equal to the black bold distance.

element.value: 4 RETURN distance between S[l] and P[r];

message.content: The white node is within the vertical strip.

element.value: 1 SelectVStripNodes( S, l, r, d, x ):
3 FOR (i = l; i <= r; i = i+1)

message.content: The white node is within the vertical strip.

element.value: 1 SelectVStripNodes( S, l, r, d, x ):
3 FOR (i = l; i <= r; i = i+1)

message.content: The white node is not within the vertical strip.

element.value: 1 SelectVStripNodes( S, l, r, d, x ):
3 FOR (i = l; i <= r; i = i+1)

message.content: The algorithm will now select all the yellow points which are contained in the vertical strip centered on the red point and whose width is equal to the shown distance.

element.value: 4 RETURN distance between S[l] and P[r];

message.content: The white node is not within the vertical strip.

element.value: 1 SelectVStripNodes( S, l, r, d, x ):
3 FOR (i = l; i <= r; i = i+1)

message.content: The white node is within the vertical strip.

element.value: 1 SelectVStripNodes( S, l, r, d, x ):
3 FOR (i = l; i <= r; i = i+1)

message.content: The sky blue and yellow points within the vertical strip have been selected. The algorithm has now to look for a distance between a sky blue point and a yellow point within the strip, which is smaller than the black bold distance.

element.value: 4 RETURN distance between S[l] and P[r];

message.content: The distances between the red point and the yellow points have to be compared with the current minimum distance. If a yellow point is below the horizontal strip centered at the red point and whose width is equal to the black bold distance, then this point can be ignored afterwards.

element.value: 1 SelectVStripNodes( S, l, r, d, x ):
3 FOR (i = l; i <= r; i = i+1)

message.content: The white node is above the horizontal strip centered at the red point and whose width is equal to the black bold distance: then this point can now be ignored (even though it might be reconsidered afterwards).

element.value: 1 SelectVStripNodes( S, l, r, d, x ):
3 FOR (i = l; i <= r; i = i+1)

message.content: The distances between the red point and the yellow points have to be compared with the current minimum distance. element.value: 1 SelectVStripNodes( S, l, r, d, x ):
3 FOR (i = l; i <= r; i = i+1)

message.content: The minimum distance between any two points in the sky blue and yellow sets has been computed and it is shown in red.
